column5: I have an issue with one of my shimano reels and the other I would just like to have serviced/cleaned,  does anyone know if I can just drop them off at their building in Peterborough or do I have to mail them. This is what I am talking about http://www.shimano.com/publish/content/global_fish/en/us/index/customer_service0/Repair_Services.html Thanks everybody, Mack
Yes.. unless something recently changed you can walk it in in the Peterborough industrial park.

?  Not sure what you mean?  I bought the citica I need repaired/looked at at gangons in oshawa but it was early in the year and I think I will have better luck at shimano. Plus I would like to get my caenen cleaned and oiled plus whatever else it needs.
You can take it right there - and they do good work. I have all my musky reels serviced there - they have the parts if any are needed...  Pete
They are on Pido Road in Peterborough, just off the Bypass, take the Ashburnam cutoff
Took a journey out there Saturday,  while I was in Peterborough but they were closed but at least I know where to find them now thanks everbody
while you are there, please feel free to admire that beautiful grey epoxy floor...have my sweat and blood in that floor ha  what is wrong with your citical? just curious
does anyone know the cost of maintenance if i sent it to them? a curado baitcaster
cost of maintenance? if it's just a general clean up, lube, etc usually about 30-40 bucks, last time I sent a reel to aikmans anyways, not sure on shimano's pricing for that
"took a journey" I suggest aikmans if you're out that way
John clean and lubd them yourself, its simple and pretty much free.
